Pros:
+Developer accepts suggestions, listens very closely to audience
+Funny sense of humor (subjective)
+Unique combat system, but shields are lacking
+Pretty cheap!
+Tons of little secrets to be found: extends play-time massively
+Arena mode for when you run out of campaign content to play
+Almost zero gamebreaking bugs that stay for more than 2 days
Cons
-Developer does not have scheduled updates
-The campaign runs out of content fast depending on how much combat entertains you/if you dont like to go on item hunts
Conclusion:

34451492.review:
Warcube is a simple game based off of popular systems found in other games, like Shadow of Mordor and Mount and Blade. It includes top down camera that provides a nice view of your character, the "Warcube", as he slo-mo kills his way around levels that can be entered from an overworld. 

As you travel level from level you will come across loot that can be grabbed and equiped that change how you fight in game. You can tank it out with heavy armor, a shield, and a big weapon, or you can fly around levels with minimal clothing, with a dagger in one hand and a bow in the other. The best part is that there isn't any true meta to the game, any combination can work.

 Not only is the game itself a blast to play, but the developer is also trying his best to communitcate with the public to fix and improve the game. Each update brings more fun gameplay and hotfixes are commonly released to fix any issue that might arrise from the new patch.

33843169.review:
Alright, I really want to like this game.  I really do.  But there are some little things that just bring down the whole experience for me.  Let's start with the combat.  When it works the way it should, it's awesome!  You can string together attacks to take down a large group of enemies in one long and exciting chain and it's just incredible BUT!  There are glitches and bugs which ruin it for me.  For example, I'm trying to take down one enemy, I aim my attack, and one of three things can happen: 1, I hit the target successfully; 2, my character turns just a bit to the left or right (without me actually doing so) and misses; or 3, my character goes flying in the complete OPPOSITE direction I was pointing!  Not to mention there are some enemies that either can't be killed or take far, FAR too many hits to take down.  (Might just be me)

(EDIT: An ingame options menu has been added, thanks craigz!)

I would like to reiterate that I really, REALLY want to like this game.  I think it has lots of potential to be an extremely fun and enjoyable experience.  But at the time of writing this, it's not.  At least not for me.  The issues I pointed out above as well as a few others just drag the whole thing down for me, and for that, I can't recommend it.  Hopefully, in the future, this will change, and I will be able to change this thumbs down to a thumbs up.

32520445.review:
Warcube is a fast-paced combat game. Obviously, because if you are the intelligent individual you are, you read the description before reading reviews. Now on to the actual review. I am going to be doing a 10/10 review on Graphics, sound, etc. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Graphics
The graphics in this game are cartoony and I can see how that might make some people look the other way but hang in there. The graphics are not at all realistic in any way, meaning they are minimalistic, simplistic, and cartooney as mentioned previously. I personally like the simplistic graphics but I still think they could use some work.
Overall I would rate the graphics a 6/10

Obviously, graphics are not the main selling point in most indie games so if you have bought indie games previously with simplistic graphics this should be fine. Even if you haven't you will be fine.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sound
There are some decent sounds in Warcube. The sounds overall are not revolutionary, however, they are still good and are probably better than what you will find in a lot of indie games, but still not revolutionary. 
Overall I would rate the sounds a 7/10

Same with graphics sounds are not the main selling point of indie action games so that is why I give it the rating I did.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gameplay
The gameplay in Warcube is about the most unique and fun things I have played in a LONG time. You use a variety of weapons found throughout the game including, dynamite, crossbows, and the legendary sword in the stone! There are some problems with the aiming reticle when you try to charge a melee attack or shoot a bow. But don't let that hinder your feelings for the game because for me it doesn't happen that often and in the heat of combat even if it does mess up you will still hit someone so it is fine.
Overall I will rate the Gameplay a 9/10

This is the main selling point of the game and I believe that the game does deserve this rating based on its current status. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gif Capture
Generally, this would not be a section in a review but this little indie game is an exception. The game has a built-in gif capture system allowing you to make gifs of the last few seconds of gameplay. Then the gif is placed in a file that is convenient menu if you hit escape during the game. 
Overall I rate it a 10/10

I give it this only because of how rare this is to see in a game and I think that it works well. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Settings
For those hardcore gamers that have the best computer money can buy, you will be disappointed with the graphical settings because there are only two settings low and high, These not changing much but still a welcome addition. The audio settings are probably what you would expect from this type of game, master volume slider, music slider, and SFX volume slider. The third and final section of settings are the game settings including key remapping, cursor visibility, and a few others mentioned below. 
Graphics settings (in order of appearance)
Quality - Low or high 
Ambient occlusion (AO) - On or off
Toggle fullscreen - On or off
Antialiasing - None, 2x, or 4x
Map shadows - On or off

Audio
Master volume slider
Music volume slider
Sound effects (SFX) volume slider

Game 
Key Remapping - which allows you to change any of the keys to any button
Epic Gif Capture - Which allows you to capture "epic gifs" applying a filter to the gif
Cursor visible - allows you to turn the cursor on or off
Reset game - which by its name resets your progress
Isometric movement - This turns off fluent movement basically only allowing you to move in the cardinal directions
Frames Per Second (FPS) display - Shows your frames in the top right corner
Overall I will consider the settings a 7/10 

I give it this score not because the settings don't work but because I think there could be more of them, especially for graphics. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Easter Eggs 
There are a good number of easter eggs in the game waiting for you to find. I am not going to list them here because they are easter eggs you are supposed to find them yourself. 
Overall I rate this a 9/10

I rate it this because the easter eggs in it are good and make sense but there could be more. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Content
The game has A LOT more content since it launched back at the beginning of 2017, however, this game is still VERY, VERY MUCH in development. Right now there are 14 complete maps, a map that is still under construction but is available to play, and two maps you can see but can't play. Each map consists of probably 20 minutes of game time for completionist route and about 10 minutes for casual play. There are, however, a lot of weapons and armor already in the game and readily available each with different looks and slightly different stats. also. there are some cosmetics that you can apply to yourself to look different but that is all they do. Finally, there is a special ability which is not going to be the only one but for now, it is. 
Overall I give this a 7/10

Hear me out as to why. Right now I know there is not all that much content but Craigz (The developer) is very good at getting content out is really working hard so I believe we will see this game go a long way.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Devs and Communication
Craigz works on everything in the game, except for sound which Blake works on, but Blake doesn't really respond to anyone because he is not full-time on the game. Craigz, as I said before, is very hard working and is working on the game full-time resulting in a lot of communication and soon to be content. Also, Craigz and the mods (myself included) will almost certainly address any problems, concerns, questions, or anything of the sort relatively quickly. 
Overall I give this a 9/10

I give it this because with the combination of a lot of communication from the mods and the dev along with the dev working full-time on the game it is well worth a 9/10.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This concludes the review, I will be updating this as I see fit and feel free to leave me or any other of the mods and or dev a question in the forums, discord or twitter and we will respond to you as soon as possible.

32399913.review:
(This is an Early Access review based on version 0.0.5v3.)

Warcube is a fun brawler, though a bit limited and easy right now due to being in very early access. The best part is being able to do combo attacks that wipe out an entire enemy group in slow motion - it's exactly as fun as it looks. The worst part is the janky Unity physics when it comes to platforming, along with needing to reposition the camera correctly.

Hopefully later patches improve on the physics and camera, as well as adding more and harder content. For now I'd say that it's not worth the $10 asking price due to the lack of content, but that it could easily be if you're willing to bank on it being improved in the future.

This game is the peak of indie development.

In Warcube you control a blue cube (a symmetrical three-dimensional shape, either solid or hollow, contained by six equal squares) and you travel around this world with deserts, snowy biomes and flat plains and counquer red outposts.

As this game is in Early Access, completing the game (For all of you completionists, such as myself) It only takes a couple of hours to complete it, but with the developer (Craigz) working his hardest and constantly updating the game, there is always something new to come back to in the following weeks.

Anyways, if I were to rate this game right now, as an unfinished game, I'd give it    ✯✯✯✯✰   , but I can see the huge potential this game has to offer. Other than the bugs, (such as sometimes your cubes doesn't aim where your curser is, or how sometimes the merchant goes into outpost enterance zones, making you not able to buy stuff until he leaves) it's a pretty solid, fun game.

But who cares what I think, lol

32154398.review:
Like shadow of mordor, but cool.







For real though, I've been with this game since "day one," and though it is still in development and it has all the bugs to show for it, it has been enormously fun, despite using such small cubes. Now, my sarcastic comment about shadow of mordor is actually not too far off. The individual enemies lack various traits, and there are not many special moves so far, but otherwise, it plays like one would expect a top-down version of shadow of mordor should. I am not saying that this is a simple copycat game, oh no, this is a game that is going against the grain to be unique, and it doesn't cut corners doing it. There is no need to take a chance when you roll with these cubes.
This is a game optomized for the professional gamer, with slingshot and slo-mo mechanics, you can dish out all kinds of six-sided fury, should you have the skills.
Not a professional? No problem! Combat is actually quite simple, as you parry when a symbol appeasr over your foes' heads and click on them to attack.
The music give the feelings one should have when on an epic quest and is greatly improving with the help of the new team member, Blake. (Though he looks more like a rectangular prism than a cube... Whatever, I don't judge.)
The graphics are crisp and unique.... I suck at describing graphics. Er... The characters all have six sides, which is nice for consistancy.
As for the plot, WHO NEEDS A PLOT WHEN ALL OF THE CHARACTERS HAVE SO MANY SIDES?! Seriously, you won't find a two-dimensional character anywhere in the game. Go on, look! See, I told you.
Anyway, it is a good game with a good developer. Unlike many, he has actually been updating frequently and adding good content instead of just hats... er... ah well, at least he keeps adding new features and content of all kinds.
It is still in beta or alpha or... Aw heck I forget. It's growing and it's fun what more do you people want!? Now get off my lawn!

30978611.review:
Its not easy being a cube and being a war cube is even worse, but you know what is the worst of all, that you are sent back to an old kingdom, Your Old Kingdom! By mister I am so funny narrator and everybody knows you and that you were the king. But given the fact that in this kingdom everyone is a cube and the fighting makes great fun and the fact that you are kind of a king, even if your mighty kingdom is run down by barbaric red cubes, it is not that bad. 
That is kind of how the game of war cube starts, a small little combat game full of humor and all kind of medieval stuff. As already stated the game has good humor but I see the danger of this element becoming too powerful. In this state of the game the humor is hold back to an agreeable amount but if the game is going to define itself just through its humor, I may have to give it a bad review in the future. 
The surrounding and different levels of the game are drawn beautifully in a now getting so popular low poly graphical style. The world (in this stage of the game) is rather small but given the fact that it is still in early accesses it is in place to hope that the scale of the game is getting bigger and bigger. Because now the game is finished in about 2 hours. Are this 2 hours fun? Yes they are but they leave the player with the slightly uncomfortable feeling of "I want more!" and "already finished?"
In the whole game there is no single indication of which weapon is the best and if the newly found armor is better than the other. A situation which let me to always fight with the same weapons what is not that bad (in this stage of the game) as the variety of armor and different weapons is almost equal to zero. Moreover I think a looting system where you can get some stuff out of the enemies you kill can help the game. I know it is not a revolutionary idea to make a looting system but I desperately want this game to be developed and to give the player more to do inside of the game because just exploring and good humor is not enough. Therefore I would also love to see a good development in the tactical view as I think the rather monotone getting combat system would match very well with a bit of strategic warfare with the tactical view. And moreover it would be interesting to see what bigger battles with warcubes would look like. As I said I think that is a huge area of development that would give the game great dimension. Because what the game does till now is creating a good framework. Now its time to get depth into the game and the different game assets.
I talked about a general framework of the game being created but this framework is also useful for something else, because this simple framework gives the player something to built his own imagination and own stories around. These aspect of the game principle is the same as in Mount and Blade  as the player can add to the game experience by his own imagination. For example when I hid in the bush and sneaked up to an enemy I was like "Whoa! That's a great experience I fell like I should have felt when I played Assassins Creed 3". No that is a bit over the top but I found it interesting that this simple game could generate the same feeling of excitement and anticipation as a huge game like AC 3.
In general the now existing early access game is rather small but is already playable and gives adequate game fun and I am especially excited how much potential this game has. So with more time put into development this game can become a real winner.

30264238.review:
Some gameplay:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nr-mFUbRmkc

Warcube is a little gem, it's pure fun from the ground up with a fantastic art style and neat controls. It is still early access because there is a fair amount still in contruction within the game world. You will often come across areas with traffic cones lining the environment and the developers own little cube character doing something amusing while he admits that he should be working on the game. It's great that the developer took the time to add these little characters and it really shows how much love he's poured into the game so far.

The controls are a simple affair, left and right mouse buttons control your main melee dash-attack and your ranged weapon respectively whilst you move around the world with WASD, space jumps. This allows the combat to remain fast but fluid, the slow motion combat kicking in when you chain attacks together. The combat can be challenging at times when arrows start raining down and the larger enemies forces you to keep changing your tactics.

The world that i've seen so far is well made and charming with many little characters to interact with. A great sense of humour is apparent in all these meetings which makes you want to explore and find new NPCs to talk to.

I would definately recommend this game, it's polished, charming and funny and at this price it's already a good deal. As more content is added, it may well evolve into a steal.

别具一格的游戏！
这款游戏在我看来是值得肯定的，首先在你打开的的时候，并没有直接让你开始玩游戏，而是诚恳地感谢玩家购买了这游戏，这是让我下定决心写一篇评测的原因，一个把玩家放在心里的开发者是值得肯定与尊重的。下面来说说游戏，虽然作为一款仅仅只有几百MB大小的游戏。但是简陋的游戏内部无不体现了开发者的用心，特别在于UI设计，虽然只是一些小细节，但是却会让你倍感亲切。游戏过程中，我感受到了浓浓的塞尔达传说的气息，对于PC党来说，这还是蛮新奇的。战斗过程引入了类似子弹时间的设计，对于打斗感的提升是很有帮助的（至少我玩起来居然感觉几个方块打架蛮燃的）。接下来说说画面,作为一款Low-Poly风格的游戏,在画面和技术上有较好的平衡，但是不得不说，画面依旧有待提升，很多地方还是太简陋了，同时游戏内物品的细节很有欠缺。对于场景建模来说，还是可以接受，但是人物只是一个方块，在观感上有先天不足（或许有玩家会喜欢这种风格）。所以如果这游戏继续开发下去，或许可以将人物变成人形。再说说操作性，相信精彩的宣传片是吸引很多人购买这游戏的首要理由，但是实际操作下来，就键盘来说，很有难度。特别是人物的转身有些凝滞感，对于攻击的判定也很奇怪，很多情况下都打不到敌人。最后是敌人的AI设计，或许我的要求太高，但是如果加入会配合的敌人，这款游戏的吸引力会更高。
对于这款游戏来说，是有缺点，同样也有优点。正如一句话，道路是曲折的，前途是光明的，我希望这游戏可以更好的发展下去。
PS:价格良心
致开发者：希望游戏语言加入中文，因为中国市场可以成就你，也可以毁灭你。我希望是前者。

29669446.review:
[h1]Intro[/h1]

Do you like building and grinding to build more to grind more? No? Good, because you're not doing either of those things here. Warcube is an action adventure RPG that takes inspiration from a few well received and critically acclaimed games, and and [i]it manages to handle that inspiration well[/i] while at the same time not feeling like a bunch of 'cool' features tacked on at random; the developer did a good job of making sure things fit well into the game.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The combat is great, you could compare it to Shadow of Mordor because of the combo potential with the slow motion of the 300 movie remake, but quite a bit harder as attacks are aimed 100% manually and your mistakes are easily punished by your opponents; if you rush into a group of enemies and miss one of your combo hits, your melee attack will go into a cooldown, the length of which depends on the weapon you're currently using, and you'll be stuck in amongst a large crowd of enemies with your ranged weapon and parry. If you die, the enemy that struck the killing blow will grow into a larger, tougher and more powerful enemy, and will do so again should you lose another fight to it. The videos and gifs on the storefront do a great job of showing how the combat functions, so go look at those.

The game is "open world" in that the world is open, but the levels aren't. In the world map, you move around to points of interests, like camps, castles, towns, and other stuff, which all act as levels which you enter. Some of these points of interest send enemy soldiers out into the world which if you happen to run into, it can cause an ambush encounter where you fight a wave of 20 or so enemies. You can capture these locations, at which point they'll start sending troops of your own to [spoiler]a seige camp outside the first major castle, which is currently in progress[/spoiler]. You can move near them and click on them to have them follow you into levels and encounters, where despite seeming to be half baked, they will fight the enemy until they die.

Levels aren't all that complex, the objectives are pretty simple actually. Kill enemies, capture the flags and open chests for gold, sometimes doing these things aren't all that simple, sometimes the location of things isn't really obvious, sometimes what you have to do to get to the next area in the level can be hard to discover and sometimes it's just a challenge to actually get there.

Something else about combat is that there's a stealth element, if you haven't been spotted by the nearby enemies, you can sneak around in the often copious amount of bushes to either get into a good position to start the encounter or [spoiler](most probably unsuccessfully)[/spoiler] sneak past them entirely

Another thing is there's some very well implemented easter eggs and references that are there, you know they're there, but they're not in-your-face obnoxious, or in your way, screaming "LOOK AT ME!". I really hope the developer does more stuff like this.

[h1]Story Stuff[/h1]

There isn't too much story yet, so far we know that you're a godlike being that has been gone from their land for almost 4,000 years, and it seems said land is in the hands of your enemy. Even though there isn't really much story so far, what's there has a nice and enjoyable charm to it, and the narrator / floaty head guy is quite a funny character. Some 4th wall breaking, but it certainly enhances the experience as it's done well.

[h1]Early Access / Developer information[/h1]

As far as Early Access goes, I have very high hopes for this one. I played the very first Early Access version, which had quite a few crashes and bugs, as well as some things I was concerned about, and I contacted the developer (now this can be done through the Steam forums for the game on the bug report thread), and he not only fixed the bugs and (I think) all of the crashes, but he thanked me for reporting them and said that he's currently working on addressing the things I was concerned about. The game is very much playable in the current state and I'm confident that if something big or game breaking were to pop up in the future, the developer would be jumping all over it asap.

[h1]Worth it?[/h1]

Worth is always subjective, but I can give you facts and my personal opinions to work with. I obtained the game elsewhere for my first playthrough, and bought it the next day despite $9 USD ($12 AUD) being a lot for me to spend on a game right now. Right now the game has 3 to 4 hours of playthrough content, depending on if you rush it or not, but it has plenty of potential for making your own fun by trying to pull of awesome combos or neat tricks with the current arsenal of weapons at your disposal as some hit harder and some combo faster and have very little cooldown when you miss, which can lead to some pretty amazing looking stuff.

If the currently small playthrough time doesn't bother you, then I'd seriously suggest either getting this game, following and wishlisting it and looking back every week or so, or looking up gameplay on YouTube to see if it can change your mind.

Sorry for the very long wall of text, but I've really tried to cover everything, though if I haven't you can reply to this review to ask questions and I'll try my best to answer them. Also, this is my first serious written review, so any feedback or advice would really be appreciated.

I'll attempt to keep this updated within reason, although there may be a time when there's just so much more stuff that I have to entirely rewrite it.

29595567.review:
As an early access game, this accomplishes the oh so rare achievement of being something interesting. It's not just fun, it's got a bunch of other things going for it.

[h1]Gifs![/h1]
Ever done something cool in a game and thought, "Man, if only there was some sort way I could push a button and the game would save the last 4 seconds of what I did in a convenient gif format?' Guess what! This game has that! And slow motion! That's like chocolate-and-peanut-butter level of compatibility. 

[h1]Stealth![/h1]
No wait come back, it's well implimented. This game does stealth in the way that other games should stive to: naturally. I had forgotten there was stealth because I never used it, and there was never any forced stealth section. Cut to later on, when I saw some bushes, and decided to dash into and through them, rather than engage with the nearby enemies. It's minimal, but it's honestly such a well executed addition.

[h1]An awesome developer![/h1]
The fact that this game was released the 27th. and within 3 days, craigz has released 9 seperate updates fixing bugs people had reported shows how much dedication he has to this product. I've reported 2 bugs myself, and in less than 24 hours, he'd responded to both of them, and before too long, fixed the bug. What a guy!

29556023.review:
Please skip to the end of the review if you just want my opinion on buying this game or not.

This review is from someone who not only doesn't generally buy early access titles, but from someone who also very rarely reviews games as well.

Right now, I would say the game is certainly lacking in content, but considering it is an early access title with, as of the time of this review, only a day to make progress after release, I think that can be excused for now.

What there is to enjoy and play was, for me at least, a blast. The slowdown, matrix style of the combat allows for very flashy and fast paced playing. It's as simple as it gets, but it really doesn't need much more than that. Combat is relegated to only the two mouse buttons, and from there you need to keep a rhythm going with your melee attacks to keep up the combo.

I am extremely eager and willing to see this game get developed to its full potential. And while I am reccomending this game, I could certainly understand someone who wants to wait until at least a little further down the line for the game to have progressed. As it stands there is only about 2 hours of content max, but if you feel you have the desire or spare money, I think this should be an early access title the community of steam should be pushing for.

29552026.review:
A very fun game.  Warcube is still very early in development (there's only about 2 hours of content right now), but it's filled with wonderful moments of combat and humor.  The game has a lot of polish for one-man title.  I'm looking forward to the seeing the content fill out over time.

Pros:
Extremely polished combat.
Slow motion combos feel awesome.
The levels that are finished have good design.
Looks gorgeous.
Great humor.

Cons:
Performance is rocky even on a good machine.
Missing sound in a lot of key areas.
Still very early in content development.

Overall, worth picking up if you buy into the Early Access model and want to give a promising dev a chance to grow.

29530202.review:
I have been waiting for this game for quite some time now. Not a long time, but I was one of those who upvoted it on  greenlight. Since then the developer has been very active in the fledgling community, being very positive and open to new ideas. So now that I have had a chance to play this game, I am very happy to say it was well worth the wait. 

     First impressions were very good, as the game opens with some somewhat of a dialogue after you press a strange button, the mysterious voice says you have been asleep for a few thousand years, and implies that you used to be someone of great importance. The voice acting was very good, it was very professional and believable, and does a good job giving some context to the setting.

     Although there are not too many levels fully completed, the ones that are there show off the gameplay quite nicely. The combat seems entirely skill based, as melee weapons seem to do the same damage. In combat, each melee attack is a lunge, if you miss there will be a short cooldown and you will have to wait before attacking again and thus will leave you open to attack. However, if you land a hit, you can immediatley attack again, thus encouraging players to be more deliberate while striking. When you hold down the attack button, the game goes in slow motion and an arrow appears showing where you will go, thus making it a bit easier not to miss. Don't get me wrong, its still very easy to whif, as your movement keys are factored in during the lunge. However, in a large crowd, if you are able to keep the hits going you can almost bowl right through the crowd, this is very satisfying when you manage to pull this off as a miss will lead to certain death, as a few hits will kill you.

     When killed, the enemy dealing the killing blow will grow in size and pwer. If one enemy kills you enough, they basically turn into a boss fight all on their own. While most enemies die in one to two hits, the big boys can tank enormous amounts of damgae and deal just as much with every swing. The only problem is that eventually, the enemy will get so large he won't be able to hit you, though this is probably just a glitch.

     Ranged attacks are both satisfying and frustrating. It is very nice to land a shot and see the enemy fly off screen, especially when leaping through the air. It takes a bit of getting used to but its still fun.

     The look of this game is very nice, its simplistic with bright popping colors that suit the cube theme nicely. Environments are fun to explore and move around.

     All in all this is a fun game, combat is solid, the asthetic is nice, I like the character personlization in this game as you can buy new outfits or find them as well as other cosmetics. I look forward to seeing nerw content come out, as there are only a few levels available at this point, but I can see there is much more to come. Definetly recommend pickling it up.

29529676.review:
So, I'm seeing a lot of "received this product for free" reviews which is awesome! Glad people are reviewing this game. But, as someone who personally always is a little leery of those, I wanted to post a "I paid $10 for this" review.

And it was definitely worth the money.  

There are glitches, it's pretty brief from what I can tell, and for the love of god the movement needs to be tweaked.

But it is REALLY. DAMN. FUN. (If you want to see gameplay details, I did a video of the beginning of the game here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEMW8EhM1MU&feature=youtu.be )

There is a lot of potential here: the way the overworld is set up is really clever, there's a lot of room for cool kingdom building and exploration mechanics, and the combat is stupidly fun. I haven't been this jolly about attacking hordes of enemies since my Dynasty Warriors childhood. The slowmo action is great, I actually really like how floaty the physics are, and even the rudimentary stealth mechanics are enjoyable. My biggest complaints are a few interface weirdnesses (the character screen was very unclear and buggy for me, the overworld map moves really slow but also teleports you) and the movement. It uses grid movement, so W is always up, A is always left, etc rather than AD rotating and WS being forward back...but the game isn't on a grid, and you dash/shoot in any direction. Dashing actually feels better as a movement method than walking, which is baffling. 

I was originally going to just try this out since it was just released today, say "its cool" and then wait for future versions, but I'm actually going to go finish the Early Access.

So quick pros cons:

Pros:
Fun
Cool combat
LOTS of potential
Designer seems nice and dedicated

Cons:
Obviously a few EA bugs
Moving on tactical map is really slow, but also serves as fast travel which isn't explained.
For the love of god make the movement turn with AD and move forward/backward with WS.

29525783.review:
Gameplay for those just interested in that: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z8tSGAIHTxE

Simple yet incredibly fun. Warcube is a twist on what you would expect a cube-based game to be thanks to the popularity of Minecraft. In this game, you focus on combat instead of building. The combat is fairly simple, but very well done and responsive. The slow-motion effect is also a nice touch since it adds a "cinematic feel" to the game when you're attempting to do a combo or perform a trickshot.

There is also a nice built-in feature that allows you to create a gif or take a screenshot from inside the game itself and uploads it to imgur. Although I don't find myself using it often, I can see where it may be useful for when others may do a move that they would like to share.

That being said, my main issue is the small amount of content currently in the game. However, I expected it going into the game so I'm not that disappointed. It is an early access game after all, and I still had a LOT of fun playing the content that is currently available (I should probably mention that - at the time of this review - I have not finished all the content currently in the game).

Overall, I really do like this game and hope it does very well, and I can't wait to see where it ends up!

29523587.review:
3 minutes of gameplay & full review commentary, if you want more details:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JH6eNyBwbGk

[h1]About the game[/h1]
Warcube is an action/adventure game, where you control, that’s right, a cube of war. You’ve returned to claim back your kingdom (and to fight red cubes). The game consists of one world map split into regions, you can “zoom in” and conquer them as you travel, which adds additional dimension to the game. The combat system is quite simple: click on the enemies to charge and damage them, but there’s a twist: after you hit an enemy, the slow mo turns on and there’s a chance to start a new attack, making you “combo” through your enemies and chain kill them. One thing that deserves extra notice is the developer’s character built into the game: there’s a small cube that you are going to meet as you progress. It gives the game personal approach and makes you feel welcome while playing.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
•	The battle system is simple, yet entertaining. Chaining combos is really fun and I feel that this mechanic is not represented enough in video games. Luckily, this game fixes that.
•	Enemy gets stronger when he kills you: It’s a pretty cool mechanic that prevents mindless rushing.
•	Interesting approach to early access: “developer’s character” makes you feel welcome
•	Different maps that don’t feel repetitive
•	Neat, minimalistic style
•	Great soundtrack
[h1]Cons[/h1]
•	Movement seems clumsy: especially when you’re going up the slope and trying to jump. Jumping is complicated: not because of challenging terrain, but simply because the jumping mechanics are not implemented well enough yet. Overall, control responsiveness could be a bit better.
•	Not much weapon/equipment variety so far
Summary

You can see that developer puts his soul into the game: even though there is not too much content yet, there’s a good attention to detail and his „personal” character presence in the game makes you feel very welcome. Overall, I’d say get it if you want to influence how the game is developed. Otherwise – wait for full release to experience the game completely.

29523250.review:
These days, thanks to the likes of popular games like Minecraft or Roblox, we've come to associate blocks and cubes with building and creation. Sure, cubes can be used to make stuff, but they're also excellent at destroying things!

In Warcube you assume the role of a little cube, whose sole responsibility is to reclaim the land from the red bandit cubes. It's clearly evident that the developer has drawn inspiration from the games mentioned in Warcube's description (Shadow of Mordor, Assassin's Creed, Mount & Blade etc) which is excellent for me personally, as I LOVE the free-flow combat mechanic that SoM had, but even more so that the Batman franchise had as well. To find similar mechanics in a game that's clearly as different as Warcube is, is exciting.

Warcube is obviously an early access title and still has a long way to go before it develops into the game that Craigz (dev) envisions it to become, but I have high hopes for the future of Warcube. With the addition of the Arena mode that's coming very shortly, the game is going to have even more to offer than it has now, and whilst I don't yet know what the Arena mode will be like, I can only hope that it's going to be something as addictive as the Endless Mode in Clone Drone in the Dangerzone (RIP 30+ hours).

One thing that I feel I really need to mention here is that I have never in my life spoken to a developer that has so obviously been so heavily invested in his creation like the developer of Warcube is. Craigz lives, breathes and dreams Warcube and this is exactly the type of developer that I believe will see his product all the way through and out of early access to full release (unlike many others who abandon their games and remain in EA forever). Every bug that I've reported to him and suggestion that I've made on improving the game, he has actioned immediately. He understands and realizes that the input of his community is essential in the development of a successful game, and this is what we as consumers value most (personal opinion).

The one thing about Warcube that I personally feel needs to be changed, is the soundtrack. I've mentioned this to the developer and he is currently searching for something that's both thematically appropriate but significantly more energetic than the music that the game currently has. Music is very important to me, particularly in a game, and Warcube's music is definitely lacking in energy and inspiration. An upbeat chiptune track would make the game considerably more enjoyable than it is now.

TL:DR The time that I've spent with Warcube so far (almost 3 hours) has been great, and I very much look forward to see where the developer takes it in the future.

If you're interested in seeing what Warcube is like, you can do so here - 
https://youtu.be/wjArFzKOk70
https://youtu.be/Dh1hIGj2Zio

The resolution upscaling issue has now been sorted by the developer, and the game properly upscales to native resolutions up to 4k.

29523044.review:
Warcube has a solid core idea, setup and base quality - but there is a lot of work left on this title.

Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmD1hdxE_mM

Text:
Warcube looks very nice, and even with the limited scope of it's character designs, it all gives a certain level of charm and unique immersion. With diverse landscapes en scenes being available, and excellent level design creating enjoyable gameplay. And the gameplay is mostly solid - Cool slow-motion and active combat with movement and timing at the fore-front, accompanied with fitting sound and music and set with a good bunch of interactive elements to facilitate gameplay. 

Where the game starts to show its gaps, is quite literally - in the gaps of content. There is just so very little of it. The early access build only has about 2 hours of content available, with limited replay value. The content that is here - is very fun, but there is very little of it available

Another issue, but very minimal comperativly, is the physics. They feel and act very floatly and "heavy" at, seemingly, random. Very sad.

Overal a very solid build in terms of quality and design, with a solid set of core mechanics that mostly need expanding and MORE of everything. More levels, more enemies, more dificulty options, more items, more combat mechanics, etc... A cool and interesting game that deserves your attention, but might also need a bit more content to be worth the money.

[h1] I'm giving a bad review of this game because there aren't enough bad reviews.[/h1]

[h1]Graphics[/h1]: 4/10, the graphics and atmosphere are the main flaw of this game. The tone a feel just feels a little off. The world just doesn't make since, and everything is just a simple cube. I'm sorry, but even bad games make better characters then this.

[h1]Fighting System[/h1]: 7/10, the fighting system is simple, but it's really the core of the game. If it's worked on more, then fine, this could raise up to an 8/10, but it just doesn't have a variety of moves, just chain kills and arrow shooting. The stealth is brain-dead easy and everybody dies in one hit. I do love games that prefer more enemies over stronger enemies, though.

[h1]Level Design[/h1]: 2/10  unlike games like Dishonored, Shadow of Mordor, and Assassin's Creed, the levels are very flat and linear. An important part of hybrid stealth-action games is a clear stealth route, action route, and a suprise route ( a route where you can jump out and kill an enemy, and go back in hiding), and according to this game, there's only one main route.

[h1]Overall Rating[/h1]: 3/10, this game is too linear and has bad atmosphere

39674681.review:
워큐브는 단순한 롤플레잉 게임에(레벨X) 수십명의 적군을 슬로우모션으로 후려 칠 수 잇는 게임입니다.

일단 저는 이게임을 매우 긍정적으로 생각하고 있습니다.
의의로 자유로운 커스터마이징에 병력증대, 무난한 그래픽, 또 개발자의 지속 개발로 저는 이 게임을 구입하셔도 될 것 같다고 생각됩니다.


배경을 자유롭게 돌아다닐 수 있으며(T키로 맵축소 가능), 근처에 캠핑을 짓고 시간을 빠르게 보낼 수 있습니다. (R키를 누르시면 됩니다.)
[가끔일부 지역에서 오류로 워프가 뜨는 경우가 있습니다.]]

아이템은 근접무기 10개이상에 여러분에게 맞는 갑옷(무사,기사,발레리사[?])과
원거리 무기(현재 3개 정도로 예상됨),
후반부에는 여러분들을 위해 싸워줄 수백명의 병사들이 있습니다.

아, 다만 처음에는 무기가 구리다는걸 명심하시기 바랍니다.


그러던 중에 맵을 돌아다니는 빨놈이랑 싸우는 경우와, 기지를 침투해 전멸하고 깃발을 장악하셔야 되는데

전투과정은 간단합니다. 마우스 왼,오 두 클릭을 잘 활용해 딜레이 없이 싹 쓸어버릴 수 있습니다.
다만 싸우는 과정에서 옆,뒤에서 옆뒷치를 할 수 있다는 점 명심하시길 바랍니다.
방어가 가능한데 마우스 휠 또는 E키를 누르면 방어가 가능하니 타이밍에 맞춰서 적의 공격을 막아보시기 바랍니다.

만약 적군에 의해 목숨을 잃을시 당신을 죽인 그 빨놈은 뒤에 깃발을 꽃으며 몸이 점점더 커지게 되는데
그때 빨리 처리를 하지 않으면 더욱 골치아파 집니다. (체력,힘이 더 증가)


그러면서 점차 기지를 점령하고, 상자를 얻으면서 부를 축적하시게 되는데,

그때는 근처 떠돌이 상점가한테 가서 좋은 무기들과 여러 도움이 되는 것들이 많이 있으니 한번은 눌러 가보시기 바랍니다!
대표적으로 아이언 장카타나, 기사갑옷, 닌자옷, 석궁 등등...

그러면서 점점 여러분은 일부 기지에서는 빨놈들의 한 성을 치기위해 일부 점령한 기지에서 아군을 계속보내고 있는 장면을 보실 수 있습니다. (감옥,소기지등등..)

[h1]여기서 가장 중요한 점[/h1]은 바로 아군들이 이동하는 경로가 모두 성으로 이루어져 있는데
성 밑에 파란 캠핑장들이 모여잇는 곳에서 아군들을 영입할 수 있으며,
업그레이드를 통해 아군이 들어올 수 있는 수를 늘려줍니다.(업그레이드는 정확히는 모르겠습니다만)

그리고 처음에 아군들은 매우 약합니다.
아군을 통해 전원 돌격을 내릴 수 있는 맵이 1개 있는데
그곳에서 아군들이 계속 죽지만, 싸우고 난 후에는 업그레이드를 할 수있는 수가 늘어납니다.
순서가 아마...

죄수-밀리샤,파이터-라이트 infantary-헤비 infantary-기사 (knight)

사냥꾼-BowCube-Crosst,Long bowcube

이정도로 예상이 됩니다.


또 다른 팁

+G키를 누르시면 GIF를 저장 하실 수 있습니다.(다만 GIF시작이 조금 늦게 시작되며, 왼쪽 상단에 뜰 것입니다.)
ESC메뉴에서도 GIF를 저장 하실 수 있습니다.

+가끔 돌아다니시면서 적하고 조우를 할 때가 있는데,
일반적으로 1대1 정면전인 경우가 많고, 캠핑장에서 만날 때는 4방면으로 적이 옵니다.

+일부 지역에 보트를 타고 돌아다닐 수 있는 지역이 있습니다.
E키를 누르면 앞으로 부스터를 하는데, 연속으로 누르시면 더 빠르게 갈 수 있습니다.

+페이지 up,down으로 시점을 돌리실 수 있습니다.
R키로 시점이 MMORPG같이 변할 수 있고, 다만 가끔 안될 수 있습니다.

+시점 과정에서 뒤에 큰 탑이나, 벽으로 인해 가려지는 경우가 있는데 이때 프레임이 조금 떨어집니다.

+하수도 차단해서 물을 내리는 지역이 있는데 그 가운데 물있는 데 빠지면 갑자기 이상한데로 워프해서
바로 죽는 경우가 있습니다.

+일부 해안가 지역에서 물에 빠지면 워프하지 않고, 계속 내려가면서 갑자기 죽는 경우가 있습니다.

2.13일 까지 얼리억세스라고 하니 한번 할인때 사보신는 것도 괞찮다고 생각됩니다.

39641660.review: great game not much gameplay but very detailed
